NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Construction work for buildings relating to railway transport

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01E15

TI_TEXT.P: Строителни и монтажни работи на релсови пътища
Lucrări de construcţii de căi ferate

SHORT_DESCR.P: In October 2014, Network Rail established 9 panel framework contracts for buildings, civils and railway engineering works across a number of regions, pursuant to an OJEU procurement process, the contract notice for which was published 21/06/2013. The frameworks cover mid-size projects with individual estimated project values between 5 000 000 and 100 000 000 GBP. The initial term of the frameworks covers the CP5 work bank October 2014 - March 2019 with an overall estimated value for CP5 at the time of 1 400 000 000 GBP (excluding VAT). Network Rail retained the right to extend the contracts by a period of up-to 5 years. This notice relates to the potential extension of the frameworks for all lots except buildings (East Midlands) and Civils (East Midlands) to cover the CP6 work bank & modify the framework terms for the period of the extension.

In October 2014, Network Rail established a number of panel framework contracts for buildings, civils and railway engineering works across a number of regions. This framework covers building related Panel Projects with an estimated value range of circa GBP 5 000 000 to GBP 100 000 000 in the London North West South Route.

Network Rail intends to exercise its right to extend this framework and the extension period is intended to be for 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019. Network Rail also intends to make a number of minor amendments to the framework terms governing the CP6 extension period. Further details are set out in Section VI and Section IV.1.1.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Network Rail retained the option of extending the contract by a period of up to 5 years.

This framework covers railway engineering related panel projects with an estimated value range of circa 5 000 000 GBP to 100 000 000 GBP in the London North West South Route.

This framework covers railway engineering related panel projects with an estimated value range of circa 5 000 000 GBP to 100 000 GBP in the London North West North Route.

Network Rail intends to exercise its right to extend this framework and the extension period is intended to be for 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019. SHORT_DESCR.P: In October 2014, Network Rail established a number of panel framework contracts for buildings, civils and railway engineering works across a number of regions. This framework covers railway engineering related panel projects with an estimated value range of circa 5 000 000 GBP to 100 000 GBP in the East Midlands route.

Network Rail is considering exercising its right to extend this framework for 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019. If extended, Network Rail would make a number of minor amendments to the framework governing the CP6 extension period. Further details are set out in Section VI and Section IV.1.1.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Network Rail retained the option of extending the contract by a period of up to 5 years.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Network Rail is considering exercising its right to extend the frameworks in accordance with the original procurements and is providing estimated indicative values for the CP6 projects currently anticipated over the framework extension periods. Network Rail is satisfied that this does not constitute the award of a new contract, nor a modification which requires a new procurement procedure in accordance with Regulation 88(9) of the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (UCR).

Network Rail intends to modify the approach to calculating the fee under the frameworks for the period of the extension moving from a fee calculation based on actual cost to a target cost approach, which is more reflective of standard market and network rail's position. Network Rail considers that the output will be broadly the same but the opportunity for additional fees to be recovered in certain circumstances will be removed to network rail’s benefit. In addition, Network Rail intends to include drafting to remove recovery of “fee on fee” where sub-contractors are used, which is favourable to network rail. Network Rail is satisfied that these changes to the framework terms do not constitute the award of a new contract, nor are modifications which requires a new procurement procedure in accordance with Regulation 88(9) of the UCR. These modifications, which are intended to take effect for the CP6 period commencing in April 2019, fall within regulations 88(1)(e) and 88(8) as the modifications are not “substantial”.

INFO_ADD.P: As highlighted in Section II, Network Rail intends to exercise its right to extend the frameworks in relation to all lots except buildings (East Midlands) and civils (East Midlands) and is considering exercising its right to extend the framework in relation to railway engineering works (East Midlands) - only information in relation to the relevant frameworks is provided in Sections II and V. The extension period for each framework is 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019 but network rail continues to reserve its right to extend the frameworks for the full 5 years extension period.

The value stated in Section II.1.7 is the current total estimated value of the CP6 work for the period of extension across the 7 Lots. This total estimated value (and each of the values stated in Section V2.4 per Lot from which the total estimated value is derived) are indicative only and include only secured projects or projects with a high probability of being secured and exclude all third party funded projects unless those projects have been secured or have a high probability of being secured. As such the value of CP6 Panel projects which may be placed during the extension period is likely to vary and may be higher or lower than the estimated values stated within this notice.
Network Rail also intends to modify the approach to calculating the fee under the frameworks for the period of the extension. Further details are provided in Section IV.1.1.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The High Court of England and Wales
